alert.note: Alert for Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 7:58PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Douglas and southeastern Jefferson Counties through 845 PM MDT... At 758 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sprucewood, or 30 miles south of Denver, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 45 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Roxborough Park, Sprucewood, South Platte and Devil`s Head. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet
